entry.title: CME Group Plans To Launch Bitcoin Spot Trading, Targeting Wall Street Demand
entry.summary:
According to the Financial Times, the Chicago Mercantile Exchange (CME) Group, the worldâ€™s largest futures exchange, is reportedly in discussions to introduce spot Bitcoin (BTC) trading. The move aims to tap into the growing demand among Wall Street money managers seeking exposure to the crypto sector.Â
The move marks a significant step for major Wall Street institutions to enter the digital asset space, following the approval of 11 spot Bitcoin exchange-traded funds (ETFs) by the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) in January.Â
A Direct Catalyst For Bitcoinâ€™s Price?Â
By introducing spot Bitcoin trading on its platform, which already facilitates Bitcoin futures trading, CME Group would enable investors to engage more easily in basis trades.Â
Basis trading, a widely-used strâ€¦

entry.title: Senate Passes Bill to Overturn SEC Rule on Bitcoin And Crypto Custody, Biden Threatens Veto
entry.summary:
Moments ago, the Senate passed legislation H.J.Res. 109 that would overturn the SEC's Staff Accounting Bulletin (SAB) No. 121,Â preventing highly regulated financial firms from custodying Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies. The legislation passed with a vote of 60 to 38, demonstrating bipartisan support for the measure.
BREAKING: ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸ Legislation that would overturn SEC rule preventing highly regulated financial firms from custodying #Bitcoin and crypto PASSES the Senate. pic.twitter.com/GDyJRCMCxy â€” Bitcoin Magazine (@BitcoinMagazine) May 16, 2024
The resolution, which had already passed the House last week, aims to dismantleÂ SAB 121. This bulletin imposes stringent restrictions on financial institutions, effectively barring them from acting as custodians for digital assets such â€¦

Marks remarked in an X (formerly Twitter) post that a new all-time high (ATH) for Ethereum could be of â€œmajor service in many Altcoin progressions.â€ The analyst made this statement while highlighting a bull flag that had formed on Ethereumâ€™s chart. He claimed that a breakout from that flag could spark a massive rally for Ethereum, which would, in turn, positively affect other Altcoins.Â

entry.title: Defiant Tornado Cash Developer Alexey Pertsev Appeals Conviction, Seeks Justice
entry.summary:
Alexey Pertsev, the developer behind the controversial cryptocurrency mixing service Tornado Cash, is challenging his recent conviction for money laundering in a Dutch court. The case has ignited a firestorm of debate within the crypto community, raising questions about developer responsibility and the future of open-source software.
Tornado Cash In The Crosshairs
Tornado Cash, known for its anonymity-preserving features, allows users to obfuscate the origin and destination of their cryptocurrency transactions. This has made it a popular tool among privacy advocates but also attracted the attention of regulators seeking to crack down on illicit activities within the crypto space.
Pertsevâ€™s legal troubles began in August 2022 when he was arrested. Prosecutors accused him of facilitaâ€¦
